required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Above-knee Socket Evaluation : Sub-ischial vs Ischial Containment
clinical_study.official_title: AK Socket Evaluation : Sub-ischial vs Ischial Containment. Multi-center Randomised Crossover Study

brief_summary.textblock: Socket is key to provide comfort and function to lower limb amputees. A new socket, the sub-ischial socket, will be compared to "traditional" ischial containment sockets, based on comfort self-evaluation, and locomotor capacities.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects wearing ischail containment sockets will be proposed to enter the research. They will be provided and fitted with a sub-ischial socket. Randomly, they will use one or the other socket for four weeks, then be tested : finctional test and questionnaires. After this testing session, they will use the other socket, and be re-tested accordingly.

secondary_outcome.description: Same question for four detailed situations

arm_group.description: Start using the sub-ischial socket for four weeks and be tested with this socket.
Start using the ischial containment socket for four weeks and be tested with this socket.

intervention.description: The subject will wear the socket for 4 weeks, and then reply questionnaires and achieve a 2-minute walking test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- can give informed consent
- aged 18 or more
- above-knee amputee, wearing a definitive ischial containment socket
- stump longer than 16cm
- wearing a liner, whatever the suspension system
- able to walk (d4600, d4601, d4602, d4608 accordinf to IFC)
- unilaterla or bilateral amputee
- able to done the socket standing
- whatever the etiology
Exclusion Criteria:
- protected person
- pregnant woman or nursing mother
- subject having comorbidities heavily impacting feeling or socket donning
- allergic to silicon
- suffering from big volume variations in a same day
- infect√© stump (may lead to lymphatic problems)
